title: LUMINA-Net: Low-light Upgrade through Multi-stage Illumination and Noise Adaptation Network for Image Enhancement
author: Siddiqua Namrah (Department of Artificial Intelligence Korea University), Suneung Kim (Department of Artificial Intelligence Korea University), ...
relevance_why: The proposed LUMINA-Net employs techniques that may inspire similar methods in audio and speech processing for low-light or noisy audio enhancements, particularly in generating clearer and more detailed outputs.
background: Enhancing images captured in low-light conditions while minimizing noise, overexposure, and color distortion.
contribution: This paper introduces LUMINA-Net to solve low-light image enhancement challenges by integrating multi-stage illumination and noise adaptation, achieving significantly improved visual fidelity compared to state-of-the-art methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often struggle with noise and overexposure while enhancing details in low-light images.
technical_comparison.novelty: LUMINA-Net improves upon these by using a multi-module framework that includes a Channel-Guidance Module, Color Enhancement, and Over-Exposure Correction.

key_innovation: Combines reflectance enhancement via channel attention mechanisms with dynamic over-exposure adjustment, ensuring detailed and balanced image outputs.
real_world_impact: By significantly enhancing low-light image quality, this framework can aid in various real-world applications like surveillance and autonomous driving, improving the performance of vision-based systems in challenging lighting conditions.

new_terms.Channel-Guidance Module: **Channel-Guidance Module** refers to a component that selectively enhances feature channels to improve reflectance quality in low-light images.
new_terms.Over-Exposure Correction: **Over-Exposure Correction** is a technique aimed at adjusting excessively bright areas in images to restore detail and balance.
